item.title: Copywriter
item.dc:creator: Admin@TGS
item.content:encoded:
About Entermotion. Entermotion is a creative design and programming studio. We work on a variety of projects for our clients, from identity design to application development. We’re a dispersed team, and we’re comfortable collaborating remotely. What’s the Job? We’re looking for someone to tell our client’s stories. We build all of our designs and programming around content, so creating unique content is really important to us. That’s about 50% of the job. Another 25% would be creating smart, easy-to-follow suppot articles for applications we develop. The other 25% would be creating have-to-read blog articles for us and our clients. We realize that’s 100%, but you’ll probably also get asked to proofread, and do other tasks to help the team. Skills.
  • Writing compelling and authentic stories that people want to read.
  • (We’re not one of those scammy SEO shops), but you do need to write content that gets indexed, and know about some of the technical points of SEO.
  • Digging for stories within your team, and with the client.
  • Writing things that are fresh, and conversation starting.
  • Headlines.
  • Being concise.
  • Empathy.
  • Proofing.
  • Organizing content hierarchically in a website.
  • Keeping track of details.
Position. This is a remote position. We’re used to working as a dispersed team so it’s important that you’re cool with collaborating mostly online. We’re flexible on schedules. How to Apply. Click the button, and…Include 5 bullet points about why you would be a good fit, your salary expectations, and a link to past work. We would rather have a short note than a long resume. ** Due to the fact that our job posts usually have hundreds of responses, anyone not following the above requirement will likely rejected immediately. Thanks for understanding! Please feel free to apply again even if you have in the past. ATTENTION!  Individuals ONLY. No recruiters or agencies please.

item.title: Graphic Designer
item.dc:creator: Admin@TGS
item.content:encoded:
Factual is looking for a Graphic Designer to drive design and aesthetic across all marketing materials.  The Factual marketing team produces content across a variety of different formats, including print, digital, executive level presentations, and branded schwag.  We’re looking for someone who can make data, technical products, and our brand come to life through design and visualizations while ensuring both consistency and authenticity across all outward facing materials.  On top of creative leadership and design ability, the successful candidate will be able to work cross-functionally, working across sales, product, and engineering. You will be the first designer hired on the marketing team, and as such you will have significant ownership of your designs and an ability to have a major impact on design at Factual. This position is in the Factual Headquarters in Los Angeles, California. Please include a link to your portfolio with your application. Responsibilities:
  • Design print marketing collateral (product sheets, brochure, flyers, case studies, presentation templates, powerpoint decks, whitepapers etc)
  • Design digital marketing collateral (email marketing, ad creative, website graphics)
  • Create executive presentations for keynotes and conferences
  • Design branded schwag (t-shirts, iphone cases, phone chargers etc)
  • Own design projects from conceptualization to end product
Qualifications:
  • Strong portfolio across print and digital
  • Excellent illustration ability
  • Expertise with Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign)
  • Expertise with Powerpoint
  • Experience with producing print materials
  • Comfort within a fast-paced startup environment
  • Ability to juggle multiple projects and prioritize workload

item.title: Frontend/Wordpress Developer
item.dc:creator: Admin@TGS
item.content:encoded:
A Hundred Years: Just outside of the scope of a lifetime, a hundred years is something we can all wrap our heads around but is still aspirational and beyond our grasp. It inspires us to rise to the occasion, to take action and accelerate change in the world for the future to thrive. For us, the 100-year filter is a litmus test for what really matters. We have a great industrial space in Downtown LA’s Arts District (with a 1966 Airstream Trailer that serves as the in-office conference room!) and would love for you to join us here. OVERVIEW: We are looking for an experienced frontend developer familiar with Wordpress to join a great team working on cool projects. Ideally you’re based in LA, but we’re open to remote work as well. You will be building and launching sites for clients like TED, ONE.org, World Science U & World Science Festival, The Smithsonian, NASA, XPrize, Renaissance Learning, and UCLA Health. QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Clean, semantic markup and well-organized JS/CSS
  • You know your shims and understand the principles of progressive enhancement - your work is usable in IE7 and gorgeous in IE9
  • Solid understanding of Wordpress architecture, developing custom themes, custom content types and creating custom plugins
  • Experience with common Wordpress plugins like Advanced Custom Fields, Gravity Forms and BuddyPress
  • You have a Github account and are following some interesting projects and people. Even better if you have some public projects we can look at!
  • You like building things. You like designers. You like making clients happy.
  • A history of shipping large sites and webapps as the primary frontend developer
  • High-quality frontend code with great attention to design detail, developed with Sass and a modern frontend build tool (grunt.js or gulp.js)
  • Familiariarity with CSS3 and the HTML5 APIs and the ability to produce flexible and carefully crafted renderings of design comps
  • A interest and demonstrated ability in the ever-evolving world of Javascript frameworks: Angular.js, Backbone.js, Ember.js

item.title: Graphic Designer
item.dc:creator: Admin@TGS
item.content:encoded:
Food52, the James Beard Award-winning online food community, recipe hub, and home and kitchen shop is seeking a graphic designer with strong artistic, communication, and production skills to help build and execute our creative vision. Work on something you care about: We’re a mission-driven company with a goal of inspiring and helping people become confident home cooks. You’d be helping to build the best collaborative and comprehensive cooking experience online. Responsibilities
  • Contribute to and maintain our brand style guide.
  • Cross-team collaboration will be a key component in your role, including managing stakeholders and prioritizing deliverables across teams.
  • Work within an iterative design process; we move fast, we listen, and we adapt.
  • Deliverables will have a wide range including email design, website assets, recipe cards, stationery, decals, and many other miscellaneous collateral pieces.
Requirements
  • You sweat the details. All of them.
  • Extreme organization. There is absolutely a method to your madness.
  • A strong background in a range of mediums, and a portfolio to back it up.
  • A mastery of your tools, such as InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop, pencil and paper.
  • Experience collaborating with print vendors. You know their processes and the deliverables that they expect.
  • You should feel comfortable giving, receiving, and managing feedback and constructive criticism.
  • HTML/CSS experience is a plus.
  • Cheerful under pressure.
  • A good sense of humor (i.e. think we’re funny).
  • NYC-based.

item.title: Partnerships Coordinator
item.dc:creator: Admin@TGS
item.content:encoded:
CreativeMornings (CM) is a breakfast lecture series for the creative community that hosts free, monthly talks at chapters in over 85 cities. The events are organized by a group of almost 500 volunteers worldwide. Team CM is looking for a Partnerships Coordinator. We are blessed to work with a core group of corporate partners that are passionate about creative community. This person will manage and drive CreativeMornings’ day-to-day partnerships business and reports to CEO and COO. We’re looking for someone who’s comfortable at the intersection of responsive client service and the changing environment of a grassroots organization. The ideal candidate has a high level of professionalism, an inherently creative approach to developing partnerships, a good understanding of budgetary planning and project management skills and consistently makes decisions with transparency and thoughtfulness top of mind. Key Responsibilities:
  • Act as the day to day liaison for CreativeMornings’ partnership clients with the guidance  of the CEO and COO
  • Own the implementation of various agreed upon partnership campaigns and marketing efforts such as sponsored theme months and branded content
  • Work in between the CM team and corporate partners to develop new opportunities for existing partners that bring measurable value to all parties involved, including the global CreativeMornings community
  • Work with Chief Content Officer to execute each campaign’s communications strategy and collaborate with Designer to create all necessary visual assets.
  • Interface with legal counsel for partnership agreements and assist with the budgeting process, tracking sponsorship payments
  • In time, evaluate partnership opportunities with new brands along with the resources required to fulfill those engagements
  • Join a team that helps encourage people to meet up so they can find what they need to live fulfilling creative lives
Requirements:
  • 2-3 years of experience in sponsorship, fundraising, membership or client service
  • Ability to think strategically about how value is exchanged across many relationships
  • Can balance organization and partner objectives
  • Hyper-organized
  • Strong communication, problem solving and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to manage multiple projects at once
  • Legally able to work in the U.S.
You will be working out of CreativeMornings Headquarters in DUMBO in the Studiomates coworking space. About CreativeMornings CreativeMornings is a breakfast lecture series for the creative community. In 2008, Tina Roth Eisenberg (swissmiss) started CreativeMornings out of a desire for an ongoing, accessible event in New York’s for all who considered themselves “creative types.” The concept was simple: breakfast and a short talk one Friday morning a month. Every event would be free of charge and open to anyone. Today, attendees gather monthly in over 85 cities to enjoy fresh coffee, friendly people, and an international array of breakfast foods. Volunteer teams organize local chapters to not only celebrate a city’s creative talent but also promote an open space to connect with like- minded people.

item.title: Front-End Engineer
item.dc:creator: Admin@TGS
item.content:encoded:
Piqora is looking for a talented, Front-End Engineer to work on our Visual Web Analytics and publishing platform. We work with HTML, CSS/SASS and Javascript/Angular. What you will be working on:
  • Content management tools for organizing and publishing media.
  • Tools for analyzing and displaying image related data and analytics.
  • Image analysis aimed at increasing conversions for retailers.
Qualifications/Skills
  • 1 to 3 years experience.
  • Problem solver and a quick learner.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Experience writing Standards-Based HTML.
  • Experience writing modern CSS (Experience with SASS or LESS preprocessors a plus).
  • Experience with Javascript and Javascript Libraries (jQuery and Angular a plus).
  • Experience with a Javascript templating a plus.
Bonuses
  • You enjoy working in a small team with direct impact on the direction of the company.
  • You love Front-End technologies, but are curious about the full stack.
  • You are interested in sharing what you learn via blogging and social media.
Perks
  • Flexible Work Hours
  • Apple Hardware
  • Ability to work on both consumer-facing and enterprise products
  • Participate directly in the decision making process
  • Catered Breakfast and Lunch
  • Near Caltrain
  • Health Benefits
  • Relocation Assistance available for the right candidate
About Piqora Piqora is an Analytics and Marketing focused start up located in the Bay Area (Downtown San Mateo). We are helping brands harness the power of the visual web through our analytics, promotions, and marketing tools.

item.title: Marketing Manager
item.dc:creator: Admin@TGS
item.content:encoded:
Aten Design Group is seeking an energized, personable, and organized Marketing Manager to join our team in Denver, Colorado.

About Us

Founded in 2000, Aten Design Group is a web strategy, design, and development company serving a broad range of clients making positive impact on societies around the world. We work on complex communications and data projects for organizations like the World Wildlife Fund, Human Rights Watch, The United Nations, Colorado Public Radio, Stanford University, the Smithsonian Institution and many others.

Aten is a great place to work. We are dedicated to creating an office culture that promotes a healthy and enjoyable quality of life for our team.

About You

You are an excellent communicator, extroverted, high energy, organized, and you love talking to people about their work and ours. You love to write and edit. You have experience preparing and executing marketing campaigns. You are excited about the big picture as well as the details of connecting with people. You like planning events ranging from happy hours to week-long conferences. You enjoy working with a team. You take your work seriously, own your responsibilities and care about the impact it has on your co-workers, our clients and the world around you.

About the Position

The Marketing Manager works with the VP of Business Development to execute and refine our marketing processes. This includes managing and contributing to the company blog and social media accounts, handling printed and promotional material, coordinating our presence at conferences and presentations, and planning company events. Some travel to conferences and trade shows will be required. Strong writing and editing skills are a must.

This position is expected to play an important role in shaping and expanding Aten’s marketing efforts. You will be responsible for implementing systems to reach new potential clients and employees.

You will be working with an amazing team of designers, developers and leadership, as well as with current and potential clients. A positive attitude, great people skills, and the ability to multi-task are vital.

Compensation and Benefits

We think we have one of the best workplaces on the planet. Here’s why:

  • Competitive salaries, commensurate with experience
  • Flexible, generous vacation policy
  • Aggressive, performance-based bonus plan
  • 3% matching retirement plan
  • Health, dental and vision insurance for you and your dependants
  • Paid conference attendance—both in the US and abroad
  • Ping pong
  • Free food (breakfast Monday, lunch Friday; snacks, coffee and beer all week)
  • Free gym and pool access
  • Open, collaborative office in a remodeled industrial space near downtown
  • Bike path access
  • Company outings quarterly

Aten Design Group is an equal opportunity employer; women and minorities are strongly encouraged to apply.

item.title: Web Designer
item.dc:creator: Admin@TGS
item.content:encoded: Background  Focus on the visual design, identity, and user experience of the Center for Open Science’s (COS) free and open source products and services.  Be part of an enthusiastic and motivated team that is helping science become more open and reproducible.  The Web Designer will employ leading edge design and user experience methods to create a professional, accessible, polished style for COS products, services, and web presence.  This role requires expert understanding of UI/UX fundamentals and design trends, an uncanny sense of style, color, layout, and typography; and someone who wants to contribute to a mission-driven, non-profit startup.  See more on GitHub. With over $12M in core funding, COS is assertively pursuing its mission by producing exclusively free and open source products and services.  We anticipate doubling our staff in the next year with talented software developers (all levels of experience, ideally open source Python and Javascript), web designers, technical managers, product marketers, and statisticians.  Also, COS provides hands-on internship opportunities in several areas on a continuous basis. Responsibilities    Design and maintain the visual brand for COS products, foremost the Open Science Framework and its associated services; collaborate with community and infrastructure teams to match visual and interactive styles with COS products, services, and web presence; Align design and creative strategies with COS mission; Produce web and print photos, websites, banners, ads, videos, and more. Skills Seeks and employs cutting edge and modern web design techniques and tools; Outstanding information design abilities; Graphical expertise in Adobe products; Technical expertise in HTML, CSS, and Javascript; Understanding of modern techniques/frameworks and single-page/API-driven front-ends; Great communicator; Desire and passion in collaborating across many functional areas of the team; Strong abilities in presenting rationale behind strategic, architectural, and design decisions; Advocate for user experience; Team player; High energy, results-oriented, productive and dedicated to high quality. Location   COS is located in Charlottesville, Virginia. Benefits   COS offers full time employees 401(k), health/dental/vision insurance, and 15 days of paid time off, in addition to a modern office space and other amenities. Applying   COS is an equal opportunity employer.  We strongly encourage applications from members of groups underrepresented in science and technology industries.  Meet our team.

item.title: Interactive Developer
item.dc:creator: Admin@TGS
item.content:encoded: You’re a builder of engaging interactive experiences and you love it. Merging digital creative and all technical aspects is your jam. You’re intelligent, you have experience, you’re up on trends, you know what’s possible but want to push yourself and your creative further than you could anywhere else. You want to be a part of something bigger—and do it with a handpicked team that is just as talented, proactive and progressive as you. And you want to do the best work of your life, while having the best time of your life. Skills: * 2 to 4+ years experience building web sites and applications in an agency environment * Strong working knowledge of HTML5 and CSS3 * Strong working knowledge of JavaScript * Working knowledge of object-oriented programming * Experience with cross-platform and cross-browser website testing * Comfortable working with version control (preferably Git) * Proficient with Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, and Fireworks * A strong sense of design * Comfortable working on a Mac * Self-starter with excellent time-management skills and the ability to meet challenging deadlines * Ability to work independently with minimal supervision * Desire to work on a small team Nice to haves: * Working knowledge of Ruby on Rails or similar MVC framework * Working knowledge of ExpressionEngine, Wordpress or similar CMS * Experience deploying to Heroku or similar PaaS provider. * Open source projects (send us your Github account!) * Advanced working knowledge of server administration and website deployment What’s in it for you: * Competitive salary * IRA account with company match * Medical & Dental insurance * A beautiful work environment * Paid vacation, sick, holiday and personal time * Culture, Wellness and Professional Development subsidies Getting in touch: Send us a cover letter, portfolio, and resume to careers@wintr.us. We look forward to learning about you. What you’re getting into: We are a tight-knit, zero-ego team working in an open, honest, creative environment. Did we mention a commitment to work-life balance? We foster an atmosphere that allows people to maintain a healthy life outside of work. About WINTR: A digital creative company. We solve the future. Uniting strategy, design and technology to generate value for businesses, brands and the people they serve by creating purposeful solutions, built to evolve.

item.title: Writer/Content Strategist
item.dc:creator: Admin@TGS
item.content:encoded:
We’re looking for a talented and passionate Front-End engineer to join the Continu team full-time in San Francisco. About Continu At Continu, our mission is to solve workplace problems with simple, intuitive solutions that delight all users. Continu is a Human Resource platform that helps unlock organizational performance through streamlined Recruitment, On-boarding, Learning and Analytics.  It’s People Operations, simplified. As our Front-End Engineer you will:
  • Be a pixel perfectionist, striving to build out beautiful user interfaces
  • Work closely with all team members in a highly collaborative environment
  • Be a great communicator
  • Be design focused and passionate about delighting our customers
  • Be comfortable speaking directly to clients if necessary
  • Be passionate about the problems we are solving and constantly looking for the best ways to solve them
  • Be a team player
  • Be active in the development community and give back as much as possible
  • Fit in and contribute to the Continu Culture
What we’re looking for:
  • 3+ years of relevant industry experience
  • An expert level of HTML5/CSS3, JavaScript & JQuery libraries
  • Experience working with JavaScript frameworks, such as angular.js to create rich interactive content
  • Experience with CSS preprocessors such as SASS, LESS, etc.
  • Experience with versioning tools such as Git
  • Experience with Responsive Web Design
  • Well-versed in modern web standards and best practices
  • Solid experience with testing and developing across multiple browsers while maintaining a consistent experience
  • A consistent desire to experiment with new technologies
  • Provide accurate timing estimates on work
  • An understanding of current trends and advancements on the web
  • The ability to work independently and collaboratively in a distributed setting
  • Experience working with style guides & pattern libraries is a bonus
  • B.S. degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent (desired, but not mandatory)

item.title: Writer/Content Strategist
item.dc:creator: Admin@TGS
item.content:encoded:
Are you good with words? Mule Design is seeking a very crafty writer who is also an admirable talker and a strategic thinker. And above all, a problem solver. Your writing must be persuasive, evocative, and tight. You must be capable of envisioning the implications of different editorial strategies and conveying these to clients. You need a strong point of view and an unflappable demeanor. Your specific background matters less than your ability to work quickly and confidently, and adapt that work to a variety of contexts. You should have a demonstrated aptitude for giving feedback thoughtfully and receiving it gracefully. You will enjoy a variety of duties and activities:
  • Working with clients to develop editorial strategies
  • Translating information architecture specifications to content plans
  • Participating in project research and requirements gathering
  • Participating in or leading workshops
  • Contributing to the overall design strategy and approach for any given project
  • Creating and documenting workflow recommendations
  • Providing recommendations to clients and team members in writing and in conversation
  • Writing application interface language
  • Writing copy for editorial and marketing websites
  • Writing blog posts for our website
  • Creating and maintaining the editorial calendar for our blog
  • Reviewing and editing written documents as necessary
You will never be bored. You will go home at 6pm every day. Apply with an e-mail including:
  • Why you are interested in this position and why we should be interested in you
  • A summary of your professional and educational history
  • Your perspective on how language considerations matter to interactive design
No attachments please. This is a permanent position beginning as soon as we find the right person.This position is on-site in San Francisco. About Mule We specialize in interactive design projects that have the potential to make a positive difference in the lives of real people. Our clients include non-profit organizations and businesses doing interesting and useful things. We like solving real-world problems through strategic design and communication. This is an opportunity to practice your craft while making the Internet a better place.

item.title: Front-end Developer
item.dc:creator: Admin@TGS
item.content:encoded:
Help change-makers tell the stories that matter (on the web). Hyperakt is looking for a talented and passionate front-end web developer to join our close-knit team and help support our growing interactive and digital work.  We are a social impact design studio based in Brooklyn. Our clients are philanthropies, humanitarian organizations, and social enterprises like Google, the Ford Foundation, the Gates Foundation, UNICEF, and the ACLU.This will be a full time contracting position that will likely evolve into a full-time position. Regardless of skill level, a cultural fit is a must. ROLE You will expand Hyperakt’s capabilities for front-end web development and help us build beautifully coded user experiences.  You will work closely with our team of UX designers, art directors, and creative directors in our highly creative, open studio. We are looking for a candidate with a strong attention to detail, a passion for developing interactive experiences, and an ability to work in a self-directed environment. You must be in Brooklyn for this position. Please do not apply inquiring about working remotely. RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Build websites and interactive visualizations using HTML, CSS, Javascript and other technologies as needed
  • Start with Photoshop or Illustrator comps and implement sites in Wordpress, Drupal or Expression Engine
  • Collaborate with UI/UX designers and other team members on concept development and rapid prototyping of ideas
  • Establish and maintain a design to development workflow
  • Serve as the production lead on a portfolio of clients
  • Communicate and coordinate with other developers or development teams working on the same projects
  • Contribute to scoping and estimating discussions with project managers
  • Find creative but practical solutions to novel problems
  • Produce quality work on schedule
  • Actively communicate with project managers and stakeholders, including client contacts, throughout the course of a project
YOU HAVE
  • A passion for using your skills to help advance important social issues
  • A positive attitude and love working with a team
  • High level of self-management and organizational skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • An eye for typography, whitespace and other details that occur at their intersection of design and code
QUALIFICATIONS
  • Hands on experience in full software development life cycle (design, implementation, testing, maintenance, documentation
  • Expert at writing well-formatted HTML
  • Expert at writing scalable and modular CSS
  • Proficient at writing object-oriented Javascript
  • Strong knowledge of Web Standards (HTML5, CSS3) in all browsers
  • Ability to adapt quickly and learn to utilize various APIs and Javascript libraries like jQuery, and d3.js
  • Experience with Illustrator and Photoshop
  • Experience in responsive design ad grid systems: JQuery Mobile, or other implementation methods (“mobile optimization”)
  • Experience with Wordpress, Shopify, Drupal and Expression Engine
  • Ability to translate requests from non-technical people to technical people
  • Ability to manage client and internal expectations, in terms of scope and timelines
  • Browser debugging using WebKitDeveloperTools or similar
  • Experience with git, or other source control tools.
  • Knowledge of 508/ accessibility guidelines
  • Bonus: Custom development with PHP and MySQL, knowledge of a higher-level language: Python, Ruby, PHP Node
  • 3+ years of development experience

item.title: Front-end designer/developer
item.dc:creator: Admin@TGS
item.content:encoded:
Milestone Creative has an immediate opening for a part-time freelance web designer/front-end developer. Must have: 
  • Proficiency in HTML5, CSS3 (LESS preferred), jQuery, Javascript
  • Availability for communication during regular business hours
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Excellent design sensability with proficiency to develop wireframes and PSD mock-ups
  • A positive attitude
Nice to have:
  • Experience creating and editing Shopify themes
  • Experience with graphic design/branding
My company Milestone Creative is small (but growing fast). We work with non-profit, non-commercial clients on various exciting projects.

item.title: Sr. Front-End Developer (remote / telecommute)
item.dc:creator: Admin@TGS
item.content:encoded:
InVision is the world’s leading design collaboration platform. We enable companies of all sizes to discover the power of design-driven product development.  That’s why designers, product managers, marketers and other stakeholders at so many of the world’s most loved designers, agencies, & corporations use InVision every day, including Zappos, Evernote, AirBnB, and Yammer. Built to foster collaboration and iteration, InVision helps our clients design, review and user-test a product before writing a single line of code, with tools for design prototyping, feedback, task management and version control. We’re well-funded and venture-backed by prominent investors including FirstMark Capital and Tiger Global Management. We’re looking for a Sr. JavaScript and AngularJS developer who can jump into an existing AngularJS application (with a lot of code) and help our team really rock. The ideal candidate can take a .PSD file and turn it into an awesome HTML5/CSS/AngularJS user experience that sings without breaking a sweat. REQUIREMENTS
  • Experience with jQuery and AngularJS
  • Experience with Less (or similar)
  • Comfort with Photoshop
  • Versed in agile development and its best practices
  • Experience using GitHub
  • Excellent communication and problem-solving skills
Bonus Points for Experience With:
  • Start-ups
  • Mobile development
  • Work on one or more interesting open-source project
BENEFITS
  • A highly competitive salary
  • The ability to work from home, the local coffee shop, wherever!
  • Stock options
  • Premium health coverage
  • Macbook Air or Pro, your choice
  • Membership at health club of your choice
  • Unlimited books from Amazon
  • Unlimited Starbucks card
  • Half-day Fridays!

item.content:encoded: Welcome to TGS Demos Sites. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start blogging!
